intro: Xysmalobium zeyheri, commonly known as the Zeyher's fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking, lantern-shaped pods that enclose its seeds. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring, adding a unique visual element to its habitat. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
